  • Deprecated Interfaces 
    Interface and Description
    desmoj.core.dist.IntDist
    Replaced by DiscreteDist
    desmoj.core.dist.RealDist
    Replaced by ContDist
    desmoj.core.simulator.Units
    Prefer usage of Java standard classes, e.g. java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit for time units. The interface Units provides constants for representing units for time, length and speed. Additionally, textual representations for these units and conversion factors are given.

    Any class implementing this interface gains direct access to all defined constants. It is recommended to use this interface in every class that has to represent values with units.
  • Deprecated Classes 
    Class and Description
    org.apache.commons.math.distribution.DistributionFactory
    pluggability of distribution instances is now provided through constructors and setters.
    org.apache.commons.math.distribution.DistributionFactoryImpl
    pluggability of distribution instances is now provided through constructors and setters.
    desmoj.extensions.dimensions.Duration
    Replaced by desmoj.core.simulator.TimeSpan This class represents durations (time spans). Each duration consists of a numerical value and a time unit. Only the time units specified in the Unitsinterface are supported. The value may not be negative.

    desmoj.core.simulator.SimTime
    Represents points in simulation time. Is used to indicate points in simulation time at which the state of the model changes. Each point in simulation time is represented by an individual object of this class and offers its own methods for arithmetic operations. Ensures that only valid points of time are generated.
    desmoj.core.report.TallyTimeSpanReporter
    desmoj.core.simulator.UTCTimeFormatter
    Replaced by PatternBasedTimeFormatter. Use this class to format TimeInstant objects using a java.text.DateFormat object. The UTCTimeFormatter uses a MultiUnitTimeFormatter to format TimeSpans.
    desmoj.extensions.dimensions.Velocity
  • Deprecated Methods 
    Method and Description
    desmoj.core.simulator.SimProcess.activate(SimTime)
    Replaced by activate(TimeSpan dt). Schedules the SimProcess to be activated at the given time offset to the current simulation time. This will allow a SimProcess to continue executing its lifeCycle method.
    desmoj.core.simulator.Condition.check()
    Replaced by ModelCondition.check() Returns a boolean showing whether the model complies to the condition tested by this method or not. Inherit from this class and override this method to return true if the model conforms to your special condition; the entity type this condition was parameterised with is ignored.
    desmoj.core.simulator.Reportable.createReporter()
    desmoj.core.simulator.ModelComponent.currentTime()
    Replaced by presentTime(). Returns the current simulation time as displayed by the simulation clock responsible for this modelcomponent.
    desmoj.core.simulator.Experiment.debugOff(SimTime)
    Use debugOff(TimeInstant startTime). Switches the debug output off at the given point of simulation time.
    desmoj.core.simulator.Experiment.debugOn(SimTime)
    Use debugOn(TimeInstant startTime). Switches the debug output on at the given point of simulation time.
    desmoj.core.simulator.Experiment.debugPeriod(SimTime, SimTime)
    Replaced by debugTime(TimeInstant a, TimeInstant b). Switches the debug output on for the given period of simulation time. If the second parameter (off) is "sooner" then the first parameter (on), they will be swapped automatically. Same parameters will result in no debug output at all!
    desmoj.core.simulator.ModelComponent.epsilon()
    Use TimeOperations.getEpsilon(). Returns the minimum distinguishable span of simulation time for this experiment.
    desmoj.core.statistic.Histogram.getCellWidth()
    The same functionality is given by getMeanWidth().
    desmoj.core.simulator.Experiment.getEpsilon()
    Use getEpsilonUnit(). Returns a SimTime representation of the granularity of simulation time for this experiment. So far, Hour, Minute, Second and Millisecond are supported.
    desmoj.core.statistic.Histogram.getMostFrequentedCell()
    Gives the same result as the first entry of the returned array of getMostFrequentedCells().
    desmoj.core.simulator.Entity.getPriority()
    Replaced by getQueueingPriority() to avoid confusing with the scheduling priority of an event or process.
    desmoj.core.simulator.Entity.getQueue()
    Prefer usage of getQueues() as an entity may be queued in multiple queues, call getQueueList() to obtaint the QueueList objects Returns the QueueList where this Entity is queued in or null.
    desmoj.extensions.applicationDomains.production.RestockProcessMT.getReviewPeriod()
    Replaced by getReviewSpan().
    desmoj.extensions.applicationDomains.production.RestockProcessQT.getReviewPeriod()
    Replaced by getReviewSpan().
    desmoj.core.util.SimRunEvent.getSimTime()
    Replaced by getCurrentTime().
    desmoj.core.simulator.Experiment.getTimeFloats()
    Depends on TimeFormatter in use. Returns the experiment's number of floating point digits of simulation time that are displayed in the various output files, as read from the SingleUnitTimeFormatter, if in use. Otherwise, 0 will be returned.
    desmoj.core.simulator.TimeInstant.getTimeValue()
    Replaced by getTimeAsDouble(). The value of this TimeInstant object as a double type in the time unit of the reference time.
    desmoj.core.advancedModellingFeatures.ProcessCoop.hold(SimTime)
    This methode is replaced by hold(TimeSpan dt).
    desmoj.core.simulator.SimProcess.hold(SimTime)
    Replaced by hold(TimeSpan dt). Passivates a SimProcess for the time given. The simthread of this SimProcess is put into a lock and the scheduler, resp. the experiment's main thread is released from its block and continues with the next EventNote to be processed.
    desmoj.extensions.grafic.util.Plotter.makeHistogramPlot(Histogram, boolean)
    desmoj.extensions.grafic.util.Plotter.makeTimeSeriesPlot(TimeSeries, boolean)
    desmoj.core.simulator.Schedulable.reSchedule(SimTime)
    Use reSchedule(TimeSpan dt). Re-schedules the Schedulable at some other point in simulation time than it already had been scheduled before.
    desmoj.core.simulator.Event.schedule(E, SimTime)
    Replaced by schedule(E who,TimeSpan dt). Schedules this event to act on the given Entity at the specified point in simulation time. The point of time is given as an offset to the current simulation time as displayed by the simulation clock.
    desmoj.core.simulator.Entity.schedule(Event<?>, SimTime)
    Replaced by schedule(Event what,TimeSpan dt). Schedules this Entity to be manipulated by the given Event at the given offset to the current simulation time. Note that the given point in simulation time is the positive offset to the current simulation time as displayed by the simulation clock. Method returns with a warning message if either Entity or Event are already scheduled in the event-list.
    desmoj.core.simulator.ExternalEvent.schedule(SimTime)
    Replaced by schedule(TimeSpan dt).Schedules this external Event to make the desired changes to the experiment or model at the specified point in simulation time. The point of time is given as an offset to the current simulation time as displayed by the simclock.
    desmoj.core.simulator.ExternalEventStop.schedule(SimTime)
    Replaced by schedule(TimeSpan dt).Schedules this external Event to make the desired changes to the experiment or model at the specified point in simulation time. The point of time is given as an offset to the current simulation time as displayed by the simclock.
    desmoj.core.simulator.Schedulable.scheduledAt()
    Returns the point of simulation time this Schedulable is scheduled at. Returns null, if the entity has not been scheduled and thus can not return an appropriate point of simulation time. Use scheduleNext() for next TimeInstant where an event-note lists this entity.
    desmoj.core.simulator.Entity.setPriority(int)
    Replaced by setQueueingPriority(int newPriority) to avoid confusing with the scheduling priority of an event or process.
    desmoj.extensions.applicationDomains.production.RestockProcessMT.setReviewPeriod(SimTime)
    Replaced by setReviewSpan(TimeSpan newReviewSpan).
    desmoj.extensions.applicationDomains.production.RestockProcessQT.setReviewPeriod(SimTime)
    Replaced by setReviewSpan(TimeSpan newReviewSpan).
    desmoj.core.simulator.Experiment.start(SimTime)
    Use start(TimeInstant initTime). Starts the experiment with the given simulation time as starting time. The experiment will not start unless a valid model has been connected to it before. Note that in order to stop the simulation at some point of time, the stop method has to be called first. StopCondition s can be given alternatively.
    desmoj.core.simulator.Experiment.stop(Condition<?>)
    desmoj.core.simulator.Experiment.stop(SimTime)
    Stops the simulation at the given point of simulation time. If no valid simulation time is given, the default is 0.0 which would not let the simulation run past that time.
    desmoj.core.simulator.Experiment.traceOff(SimTime)
    Use traceOff(TimeInstant startTime). Switches the trace output off at the given point of simulation time.
    desmoj.core.simulator.Experiment.traceOn(SimTime)
    Use traceOn(TimeInstant startTime). Switches the trace output on at the given point of simulation time.
    desmoj.core.simulator.Experiment.tracePeriod(SimTime, SimTime)
    Replaced by tracePeriod(TimeInstant startTime, TimeInstant stopTime). Switches the trace output on for the given period of simulation time. If the second parameter (off) is "sooner" then the first parameter (on), they will be swapped automatically. Same parameters will result in no trace output at all.
